title: 16 champs that have gone over 1000 days w/o a new skin
body:
Yes I'm making another one of these posts, but like I said last time I'm still going to keep going with this. Reguardless, I also feel it's necessary to keep track of this sort of thing, because really I don't have much to keep me tied down to League as I did in the past. So, let's view the list and see what's happening:

* {{champion:6}} 2239 days
* {{champion:98}} 1794 days
* {{champion:74}} 1378 days
* {{champion:32}} {{champion:77}} 1117 days
* {{champion:33}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:101}}  1091 days
* {{champion:9}} 1088 days
* {{champion:26}} 1077 days
* {{champion:82}} {{champion:35}} 1067 days
* {{champion:39}} 1053 days
* {{champion:31}} 1047 days
* {{champion:421}} 1031 days
* {{champion:266}} 1004 days

({{champion:28}} would be on the list as well since I base my list on skins hitting live servers but I'm letting her off since it's bound to come to live reguardless)

100 Day threshhold (champs within 100 days of going 1000 days over)
{{champion:8}} 969 days
{{champion:20}} 930 days
{{champion:54}} 927 days
{{champion:38}} 920 days


Now granted, before someone says it, yes some of these champs need or are in reworks currently. Such examples are Mord, Fiddle in desperate need of reworks and Aatrox as an example of one who is currently being reworked. These are completely fair observations. However, I'm still stating them because this is based off of data. It can be a fair argument that they should wait until their eventual reworks launch live till they get their new skin. I will agree to that to some extent.

On top of this, I'm aware that Riot is working on skins for other champs from their more recent state video, with {{champion:98}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:74}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:136}} remaining. So three of the top 5 are confirmed on getting skins soon, but until I see them they are going to remain on the list. 

Now this brings me to my last to point for the post: WHEN IS {{champion:6}} GETTING HIS NEXT SKIN??? He is the only champ right now on the list that has been in the top three for quite some time now, but now is at #1 and is over 2000 days without a skin! This is really the only thing that's heavily bothering me with this list. If there's just a skin coming for him soon to kick him off the top then I'd be so grateful as to not see a champ in the 2000 area, at least while that lasts.

Anyways, that's just about it. Small update on the list. Check this back in two months, see where we're at.

replies.body:
{{champion:77}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:35}} {{champion:31}} are tier one VGU candidates, meaning their turn is getting closer, and Riot might be evading skins for them on purpose at this point. Nunu will get a VGU, then he is skin eligible, before then, he will have gone 1000+ day without skin.

As for Star Guardian Urgot, they said they want to kill *ALL* meme, except Magma Chamber, so I take that as SG Urgot is happening. <3 Gotta instabuy that skin for my main.

Doubt that Starguardian Urgot will happen.
Riot has shown concerns about it, it's very likely that people are just demanding it as a joke, while there will be very few players who would actually buy that skin.

I consider myself an Urgot main, have all his skins with the chromas and I wouldn't like him getting a joke skin after such a long time. I wouldn't buy it.

> [{quoted}](name=SatomiKun,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=NVvrfEHm,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-04-23T07:12:28.827+0000)
>
> I consider myself an Urgot main, have all his skins with the chromas and I wouldn't like him getting a joke skin after such a long time. I wouldn't buy it.

This is exactly why they haven't made SG Urgot despite the huge meme. [They said as much in a reddit AMA months ago.](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/6zwvv1/were_the_rioters_from_the_star_guardian_team_ask/dmyop2g/)

I would not buy it either, and I love the Star Guardians. I think the skin would sully the line and just be too much of a gimmick. Unless of course, it was an obvious joke skin like an April Fool's skin, where it's visually a mess where it looks like he's in poorly made cosplay and called something like Definitely not a Guardian Urgot or something.

Exactly.
I am a huge fan of both, Urgot and the Starguardian skin line (Starguardian Jinx <3), but they are in no way compatible for me.

It would ruin Urgot and the Starguardian skin line at the same time for me.

As evidenced clearly with the Baker Pantheon skin. People begged Riot for a Baker Pantheon skin for years and when they finally made it no one actually bought it. People just wanted it to exist because "lol maymays".

Skin just for skins sake not actually good or worth spending money on. Unlike sailor Moon lux Which was also a fan concept before It was a real skin. Same with the skins they gave {{champion:266}}  and {{champion:83}}  and is gonna use those poor sales to say these champions dont sell skins.

Again with the argument I used for Panth, not popular champs and both have super low play rates at the time of said skin releases (and weren't good balance wise at the time of release). Doesn't take much to understand but Riot and far too many players don't get that concept.

People WANTED Yorick skins, then they reworked him and lost a chunk of the Yorick playerbase, then wondered why no one bought his skin. Aatrox lost popularity a looooooooong time ago, then they drop a skin after the fact and wonder why no one buys a skin.
Arclight Yorick was also not a skin that resonated with a lot of the Yorick playerbase.

That's cause when people wanted it and Pantheon was worth playing, Riot ignored them.

By the time they did it, Panth isn't and wasn't worth realistically playing unless "Because reasons". No one wants to buy a skin for a champ they just won't play. Panth isn't good in this meta and hasn't been for over a year outside of one-tricks that can be shut down a lot easier right now, so that was Riot's fault for shite timing, not people for not buying it years after asking for it and not getting it.

People just "want it to exist" they wanted it. It took literal years for Riot to bother, and again, by that point he wasn't popular in any way, and Riot could have taken 5 seconds to look and see that his play rate was garbo at the time of releasing the skins.

It isn't Rocket Science. There is a reason they spam Ahri skins, cause SHE is popular. Pnath is "cool" but he is not popular when he isn't strong.

Absolutely correct - but we can't forget that it took more than one year after his full relaunch (September 8 2016 - October 3 2017) for them to make a rather generic skin for Yorick who hasn't gotten a skin for 5 years before that.
I think you mean ANY SKINS before that. His only two skins, Undertaker and Pentakill, were launch skins for him.

And they waited to give him a skin until his rework had lost him a chunk of his previous fanbase (like myself), and he wasn't exactly popular OR strong at the time either. It was just asking for a failure and it was pretty clear it wasn't gonna work.
A lot of those have gotten visual updates or have them scheduled, though.

I will always make this argument: a visual update doesn't fully mean it's a new skin. Irelia, yes got her VGU recently but it didn't add any new skins along side her pre-existing ones, say a PROJECT skin. 

Urgot's rework will nearly be a one year old in the coming months and he still has 3 skins. Yes, Crabgot was drastically changed to be more Pacific Rim/Kaiju themed than B movie monster, but that doesn't change how many other skins he has or how long he's gone without a new one. That was a visual change to a pre-existing skin to fit it's title/theme better.

This will go the same for champs that are in or are scheduled for reworks, like Aatrox, Nunu, Mord, etc. Are their base and other skins going to be updated? Yes. Does that mean we're getting a brand new skin to see outside of those pre-exisitng ones, say Super Galaxy Nunu or Dreadnova Mord? No.

It does mean these champions are no longer blacklisted from getting skins though, and for the most part, champs who got VGUs do get new skins within about a year of their VGU. 

Riot does have a blacklist for champions who are closing in on VGU status, and those champs cannot receive new skins until after their VGU.

In some cases it does. Look at Galio for example. He looks largely different. There are cases where this is true like with Yorick where his skins weren't Galio levels of different, just a bit improved with the rework. Or Irelia where some of her skins don't even resemble the old skins at ALL (stupid Frostblade looking like some rando basic snowdown skin)
Issue with that is while some got VGU'd and no skin, Swain got VGU'd and got a skin.
Riot:"AHRI JHIN LUX ANNIE REEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE"
tbh, if they released an Ahri or cute Lux skin I would buy it asap. Guess I'm a fan and support them well enough to keep being rewarded with more \o/
you are the problem
I mean, wouldn't you say the fans who don't support their favorite characters are more the problem?

The problem is when your favourite champion is the crowd favourite, supporting it only pushes the other champions on the roster back further. Just because you love your waifu fox or preppy flashlight, doesn't mean that it needs a skin annually. Am I salty? I am, because my favourite champion hasn't received a bloody skin in two fucking years; meanwhile over 70 skins have been released, with a dozen champions receiving two skins in that time frame.

Some of those champions have had visual upgrades, so their entire skin roster had been redone. 

Though it's about 2 years with {{champion:203}} . I'm not biased at all. 

I also love Zilean. I thought his Bloodmoon Skin was new? Damn I'm getting old.

> [{quoted}](name=Battalion,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=NVvrfEHm,comment-id=001b,timestamp=2018-04-24T01:33:28.425+0000)
>
> Some of those champions have had visual upgrades, so their entire skin roster had been redone. 

_sigh_ I'm aware of some of these champs getting visual updates recently or are in the works for them, many people have already brought it up. But I've said this once and I'll repeat my argument as many times as this is brought up: **a visual update doesn't fully mean it's a new skin.**

Yes, Irelia and Urgot were visually updated but that affected their base and pre-existing skins. Some of their skins, like Crabgot and Frostblade had a drastic theme/appearance shift, but it didn't actually add any new skins to their roster, say like making PROJECT Irelia or Dark Star Urgot.

Outside of my rant, yeah it's really weird knowing Zilean's last skin was that long ago. It...really makes you think about how long you've been playing the game.
A visual update, whether you like to admit it or not, requires a lot of time from artists and pretty much fills that quota of artist attention for that champion.

It takes time from the artists, that's right.
But OP is right, too.

Reworked content =/= new content, at least in the eyes of many players (and therefore: Riots customers).
And many VGU candidates already got new skins:
{{champion:28}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:50}} {{champion:3}} 

{{champion:6}} being left out here kinda feels unfair, especially since he just has 3 skins to begin with....

The fact is that new art had to be remade completely, that's new content. It's just that the theme of the content isn't new, those are new skins, not just:

*pencil eraser* 
*draw in a -better- line*
Visual upgrade!

It's an entirely new game asset.

Edit: But yes, some champions get skins that already got visual upgrades and thus a whole roster of new skins as well as additional skins since then.  Not saying that's fair, I mean like my first post, I want Kindred to get a skin, I think the only one that has as few skins as Kindred at this point is Illaoi and Tahm Kench.

You forgot {{champion:154}} 
He hasn't gotten one sine the same time as Rek'Sai
...
[EDIT] and {{champion:429}} who also has not yet gotten a non-event skin since her release in 2014

> [{quoted}](name=QMighty,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=NVvrfEHm,comment-id=000e,timestamp=2018-04-23T12:31:20.433+0000)
>
> [EDIT] and {{champion:429}} who also has not yet gotten a non-event skin since her release in 2014

This bit is actually part of Zed's current problem. He's a popular champ right? Which means good sales for skins, right? Well the last 2 he got were event ones, which now can't be purchased. He only has 2 purchasable skins at any time, yet he's one of the most popular champs. It's weird.
Yea I always thought that was weird.  But poor Kalista, only getting event skins.  Seems like Taliyah might be heading in the same direction.

Maybe I forgot to add context: when I keep track of skins, I count the ones meant for ESports/LCS, so SSW, Fnatic, etc. By Riot's terms and to others, these don't count as true skins, but if I considered that, then this list would probably be so much larger and I'd be flipping the fuck out about it.

As for Zac, you kind of have to realise that maybe Riot has trouble coming up with skins for him, as he's a champion that grows and shrinks. While there are concepts out there, it may be how Riot implements them to work. Course that's just my theory.

And Kalista has...kind of been problematic in the past. Either she's really strong or in the gutter and, just going off of a quick thought, maybe not as popular as other ADCs. It does suck that she's only gotten event skins, though.

If you don't count team skins (which you shouldn't) then the only champs that you're missing are Zac and Kali (and Ryze soon).  They've said that team skins don't affect the release of proper skins, so they're still left neglected.  Especially Zac and Kali.  And just because a champion is hard to make skins for doesn't mean we should stop wanting them to get skins.  If that were the case then Donger should be exempt too since he's hard to make skins for because of his turrets.  Or when Zyra gets neglected for years we should let it go because she's hard to make skins for.
Honestly the fact that Kali's ONLY gotten team skins is really disappointing.

Skins are a weird part, because some skins are good and some are bad. For example, a skin in Malphite, no matter how impressive it might look, it can't be that good, because it only changes Malphite's appearance. There are not real ability projectiles that create something impressive, so this probably turns people away from buying skins on Malphite. Same can be said for champions like Udyr, Rammus, Skarner etc.

If you see which champions receive skins a lot are those that have projectiles abilities (Star Guardian skins, Pizza Sivir, Jhin) etc. 
There has to be something REALLY IMPRESSIVE, like Riven's Dawnbringer for example, to justify the work put into the skin in skin sales.

Vel'Koz has a shit load of effects and projectile abilities that could be changed but his last skin which did that was over 3 years ((1,181 days ago) (Arclight)). It's merely a popularity thing. Why they didn't make the star guardian event enemy Vel'Koz into a skin is beyond me.

why do people always include reworked champs? they get massive visual updates for the most part. also there's quite a few champs that are getting reworked atm and new skins would have to change pretty quickly after they came out. making skins/ changing skins for reworks takes time and money.
Maybe i'm miscounting here.  but shouldn't {{champion:37}}  be on this list as well?  didn't her last skin drop near the end of Feb 2015?
It was Feb 2016. She's not quite at the 100 day threshold but she'll be getting there in roughly 3 months.
sorry, riot has to make more jhin, lux and ahri skins

Eh, {{champion:6}} got Crabgot update which basically makes it the cheapest epic skin in the game, so I'm not complaining. It would be fun to see Star Guardian {{champion:6}} finally, or maybe a Dark Star one.

Not as urgent as the ones listed but my intelligent hentai boy needs some love. 1181 days (over 3 whole years) since Vel'Koz got a decent skin, 752 since his last skin which was "definitely not" worth it. I know Riot wants to make money from milking popular champions but c'mon! :(

meh, I like it.

I'm not a Yorick main or anything but DEUS VULTing down top into their inhib feels pretty good.
Also the maiden soundtrack on this skin is beautiful.

Would have been cool if it was a legendary and the voice changed too because Yorick talking about death 24/7 while being some light-warrior is kind of... ehhh.
